newsitem.title: USA: Republic to buy Miami car dealership.
newsitem.headline: Republic to buy Miami car dealership.

text.p: Republic Industries Inc., led by Florida billionaire Wayne Huizenga, said Monday it has agreed to acquire the De la Cruz Auto Group of Miami in a stock deal valued at $40 million.
The definitive agreement includes all real estate and will be accounted for as a pooling of interests. It is subject to government and manufacturer approval, Republic said.

Carlos de la Cruz, owner of the dealership, will remain chairman of the De la Cruz Auto Group. Two other company executives will enter into long-term agreements with Republic to retain their jobs at the dealerships, Republic said.

Republic, which has been aggressively expanding its car dealership and rental network, owns National Car Rental System Inc. and Alamo Rent-A-Car Inc. and has signed a definitive agreement to acquire Spirit Rent-A-Car.
Republic, based in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., also has businesses in in automotive financial services, solid waste services and electronic security services industries.
Republic's stock edged up 6.25 cents to $26.56 on Nasdaq at mid-afternoon.
